title: 11 Is Not A Typo
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the number of coprime pairs "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a,b)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of positive integers subject to  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0< a<b<10^{100},"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that "}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a|(b^2-11) , b|(a^2-11). "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is an example of the "},{"type":"text","text":"Vieta Root Jumping","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" technique. One may want to look at simpler Vieta Root Jumping problems first before jumping (pun intended) into this one."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First, note that for coprime pairs "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the conditions "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a|(b^2-11),"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b|(a^2-11)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are equivalent to a single condition: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ab|(a^2+b^2-11)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{a^2+b^2-11}{ab}=n."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" This can be rewritten as 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b^2-nab+(a^2-11)=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is one of the roots of the quadratic equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2-(na)x+(a^2-11)=0."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The other root, which is also integer, can be written as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c=na-b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{a^2-11}{b}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2-11>0,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2-11,a^2<ab,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0<c<a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Also, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"gcd(c,a)=gcd(na-b,a)=gcd(a,b)=1."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Therefore, the pair "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(c,a)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" also satisfies the same conditions as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a,b),"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for the same "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We apply the above argument repeatedly to any solution "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a,b)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" until we get a pair "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a_0,b_0)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_0^2-11<0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Note that we can recover the original solution by "jumping back": in the argument above "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a,b)=(a,na-c)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_0^2-11<0,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we get, since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_0>0,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" three possibilities: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_0=1,2,3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Case 1. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_0=3."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b_0^2-3nb_0-2=0,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b_0(b_0-3n)=2."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" This implies "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b_0\leq 2,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which contradicts "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_0<b_0."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" So this case is impossible."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Case 2. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_0=2."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Then, similar to the above, we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b_0(b_0-2n)=7."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b_0 > a_0,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" this implies that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b_0=7."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=3."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" By jumping back this pair "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a_0,b_0)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" leads to solutions "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(u_i,u_{i+1}),"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where the sequence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\{u_i\}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is given by condition "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_0=2,u_1=7; u_{i+1}=3u_n-u_{n-1}:"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2,7,19,50,131,343,..."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Case 3. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_0=1."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Then we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b_0(b_0-n)=10."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" This has three solutions: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b_2,n=-3,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b_0=5,n=3,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=10,n=9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Note that the first pair, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a_0,b_0)=(1,2),"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" cannot be jumped into, because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b^2-11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is already negative, so the process would have stopped one step earlier.  The other two pairs do lead to infinite series of solutions. The pair "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(1,5)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" gives a sequence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(v_i,v_{i+1}),"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v_0=1,v_1=5;v_{i+1}=3v_i-v_{i-1}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The pair "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(1,10)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" gives a sequence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(w_i,w_{i+1}),"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"w_0=1,w_1=10;w_{i+1}=9w_i-w_{i-1}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In order to count the number of solutions with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b<10^{100}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we need to find out how fast these sequences grow.  Note that they are similar to the Fibonacci sequences, and grow exponentially. The general theory of linear recursive sequences allows us to find the formulas for them."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Lemma. Suppose "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"s=\frac{3+\sqrt{5}}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t=\frac{9+\sqrt{77}}{2}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Then for all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we have
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_i=\frac{\sqrt{5}+4}{\sqrt{5}}s^i+\frac{\sqrt{5}-4}{\sqrt{5}}s^{-i},"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v_i=\frac{\sqrt{5}+7}{2\sqrt{5}}s^i+\frac{\sqrt{5}-7}{2\sqrt{5}}s^{-i},"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"w_i=\frac{\sqrt{7}+\sqrt{11}}{2\sqrt{7}}t^i+\frac{\sqrt{7}-\sqrt{11}}{2\sqrt{11}}t^{-i}."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Proof. Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"s"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"s^{-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are the two roots of the equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2=3x-1,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" while "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t^{-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are the two roots of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2=9x-1."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The general theory implies that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_i=\alpha s^i + \beta s^{-i}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for some "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Using "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i=1,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha=\frac{\sqrt{5}+4}{\sqrt{5}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta=\frac{\sqrt{5}-4}{\sqrt{5}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The resulting formula is easy to prove by induction. The other two formulas are obtained in the same way."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"s^{-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t^{-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are less than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so their powers decay exponentially. So for large "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is approximately equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{\sqrt{5}+4}{\sqrt{5}}s^i."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  So using logarithms, one can easily check that the largest "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_i<10^{100}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_{238}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  Likewise, the largest "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v_i<10^{100}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v_{238},"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and the largest "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"w_i<10^{100}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"w_{105}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, we have a pair "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(1,2),"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"238"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" pairs of type "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"239"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" pairs of type "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"105"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" pairs of type "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"w."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  This gives "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+238+238+105=582"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" pairs."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Similar to one of my problems. Excellent problem/solution! I'm glad I saw root jumping almost immediately. Just one thing though. At first, I factored by difference of squares put my answer as 0 and then realized that was stupid (like, really stupid). I got it after all, and the system marked 582 correct, but in the solutions screen it says:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Correct answer: 582 Your answer: 0"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Which isn't right. This is a bug.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Agreed that there are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 238 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" u "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" v "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Ah, I was off by 1 for a different reason: I was counting "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (1,1). "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" I guess I was lucky to get credit!

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

                                            Thanks. I missed the discriminant by 1 and used 76 instead of 77. Fixed "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"w_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", with no changes to the rest."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"You are right about "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v_i "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". I forgot to account for the coefficient, and hence included an extra solution. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I've updated the answer to 582.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            You made a computation error when calculating "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"w_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  The recurrence is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"w_{i + 1} = 9w_i - w_{i - 1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so the characteristic polynomial is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t^2 - 9t + 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  The roots of this quadratic are
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t = \frac{9 \pm \sqrt{77}}{2}."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Also, I get that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v_{238} \approx 6.21 \times 10^{99}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v_{239} \approx 1.63 \times 10^{100}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so the largest "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v_i < 10^{100}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v_{238}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Can you double-check?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I write a python program to solve it (execute time: 0.4s)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"codeBlock","content":[{"type":"text","text":"import math
from fractions import gcd

test = 1
max_num = 10 ** 100

lstb = [1, 2, 5, 10, 7]

a = 2
b = 0
while a < max_num:
    newa = a + 1
    isSet = False
    for tmp in lstb:            
        if tmp <= a:
            continue
        if not isSet:
            newa = tmp
            isSet = True
        if tmp < newa:
            newa = tmp
    a = newa

    a2 = a ** 2

    foundB = False


    for x in lstb :
        if (a2 - 11) % x == 0:
            candidate = (a2 - 11) // x

            b2 = candidate ** 2
            if (b2 - 11) % a == 0:                  
                print(a, candidate)
                lstb.append(candidate)
                b = candidate
                foundB = True
                break

print(len(lstb) - 1)

count = 0
for tmp in lstb:
    if tmp > 1 and tmp < max_num:
        count += 1

print(count)
"}],"attrs":[{"text":"import math
from fractions import gcd

test = 1
max_num = 10 ** 100

lstb = [1, 2, 5, 10, 7]

a = 2
b = 0
while a < max_num:
    newa = a + 1
    isSet = False
    for tmp in lstb:            
        if tmp <= a:
            continue
        if not isSet:
            newa = tmp
            isSet = True
        if tmp < newa:
            newa = tmp
    a = newa

    a2 = a ** 2

    foundB = False


    for x in lstb :
        if (a2 - 11) % x == 0:
            candidate = (a2 - 11) // x

            b2 = candidate ** 2
            if (b2 - 11) % a == 0:                  
                print(a, candidate)
                lstb.append(candidate)
                b = candidate
                foundB = True
                break

print(len(lstb) - 1)

count = 0
for tmp in lstb:
    if tmp > 1 and tmp < max_num:
        count += 1

print(count)
","language":null}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 11 is really lovely, we'll bring it everywhere!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let the sum of the following infinite sequence be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". 
 "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1,\dfrac{1}{2},\dfrac{1}{2},\dfrac{1}{6},\dfrac{1}{4},\dfrac{1}{12},\dfrac{1}{8},\dfrac{1}{20},\dfrac{1}{16},\dfrac{1}{30},\dfrac{1}{32},\dfrac{1}{42} \ldots \ . "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Find the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textbf{remainder}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" when "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \Bigl(N^{2014}+1\Bigr)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is divided by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#69047E}{\textbf{11}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hint","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":":- Is it really "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textbf{a}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" sequence?"}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"See that the sequence is actually inter-twined mixing of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" sequences "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#3D99F6}{1},\color{#624F41}{\dfrac{1}{2}},\color{#3D99F6}{\dfrac{1}{2}},\color{#624F41}{\dfrac{1}{6}},\color{#3D99F6}{\dfrac{1}{4}},\color{#624F41}{\dfrac{1}{12}},\color{#3D99F6}{\dfrac{1}{8}},\color{#624F41}{\dfrac{1}{20}},\color{#3D99F6}{\dfrac{1}{16}},\color{#624F41}{\dfrac{1}{30}},\color{#3D99F6}{\dfrac{1}{32}},\color{#624F41}{\dfrac{1}{42}}...."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Out of these, the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#3D99F6}{\textbf{sequence in Blue}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is
 "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle S_\infty= \color{#3D99F6}{1+\dfrac{1}{2}+\dfrac{1}{4}+\dfrac{1}{8} }..."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" which is a Geometric progression (GP) with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=1,r=\dfrac{1}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so it's infinite sum is"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\bullet \quad \dfrac{a}{1-r}\\ = \dfrac{1}{1-\frac{1}{2}}\\ = \dfrac{1}{\frac{1}{2}}\\ =\mathbf{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#624F41}{\textbf{sequence in Brown}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#624F41}{\dfrac{1}{1\times 2} + \dfrac{1}{2\times 3}+\dfrac{1}{3\times 4}+\dfrac{1}{4\times 5}}....."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This can be written as"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2-1}{1\times 2}+\dfrac{3-2}{2\times 3}+\dfrac{4-3}{3\times 4}+\dfrac{5-4}{4\times  5}+...."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = \biggl(1-\dfrac{1}{2}\biggr)+\biggl(\dfrac{1}{2}-\dfrac{1}{3}\biggr)+\biggl(\dfrac{1}{3}-\dfrac{1}{4}\biggr)+\biggl(\dfrac{1}{4}-\dfrac{1}{5}\biggr)+....\quad \text{A telescoping series}\\ =\quad \mathbf{1} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This gives "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We want to find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^{2014}+1 \pmod{11}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Observe that "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^5 = 243\equiv 1 \pmod{11}  \implies 3^{5k} \equiv 1 \pmod{11} \\ \therefore 3^{2010} \equiv 1 \pmod{11} \\ \therefore 3^{2014} \equiv 3^{4} \equiv 81 \equiv{4} \pmod{11}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus, asked answer will be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^{2014}+1\equiv 4+1 \equiv \boxed{5} \pmod{11}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{3}^{10}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = 1 mod 11"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{3}^{2010}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = 1 mod 11"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, we have to find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{3}^{4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or 81 mod 11 which is just 4.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            It is because the last term is 1/infinity=0

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Zayam Alam said it right, see that as the series goes further, the denominator goes on increasing, the overall number increasing. If you go on continuing, as he said, at very very large denominators, the terms will be tending to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and because it's till infinity, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{1}{\infty}=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" , makes the sum "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

Should've computer-bashed it!! :(

title: -1 = 1 LOL!!!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/solvable/b68b1e6509.fbd6866aa2.YXHEbb.gif"}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"text","text":"STEP 1","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":":       1 = 1"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"STEP 2","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":":       1 = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt { 1 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"STEP 3","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":":      1 = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt { -1\times -1 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"STEP 4","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":":      1 = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt { -1 } \times \sqrt { -1 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  or                                     "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i\quad \times \quad i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"STEP 5","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":":      1= "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ \left( \sqrt { -1 }  \right)  }^{ 2 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  or                                               "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ i }^{ 2 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"STEP 6","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":":      1 = -1"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Question","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":": "},{"type":"text","text":"THE ERROR IS IN WHICH STEP?","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]}]}
